definition: to offer sacrifices (to gods or ancestors) whilst abstaining from meat, wine etc
old variant of 齋|斋[zhai1]
to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc/vegetarian diet/study room/building/to give alms (to a monk)
surname Zhai
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

pair of annual sacrificial ceremonies held by the emperor in ancient times: one in the southern suburbs of the capital (bringing offerings to Heaven) and another in the northern suburbs (with offerings to Earth)

to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
